intro: Pedicularis axillaris subsp. axillaris, commonly known as the axillary lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
